item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (105 points | 8 comments)
2. Bpftune uses BPF to auto-tune Linux systems (18 points | 6 comments)
3. Constraints in Go (47 points | 19 comments)
4. CSS gets a new logo and it uses the color `rebeccapurple` (440 points | 88 comments)

6. How we made a Ruby method 200x faster (24 points | 10 comments)
7. James Gleick's Chaos: The Software (168 points | 14 comments)
8. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (741 points | 265 comments)
9. Unit Testing Numerical Routines (24 points | 2 comments)
10. Show HN: Zyme – An Evolvable Programming Language (9 points | 1 comment)
11. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (347 points | 134 comments)
12. Teach yourself to echolocate (161 points | 41 comments)
13. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (228 points | 72 comments)
14. Effect of a giant meteorite impact on Paleoarchean environment and life (113 points | 43 comments)

25. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (157 points | 26 comments)
26. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (112 points | 8 comments)
27. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (21 points | 27 comments)
28. DIMM vs. Udimm vs. Rdimm vs. Sodimm vs. Cudimm: What's the Difference? (6 points | discuss)
29. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (101 points | 25 comments)
30. SmoothLLM: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks (42 points | 15 comments)
